content.description: Start on Sock Hop but after gaining the ledge move right onto patina flakes and top out by the tree. Watch the rock below.
content.location: Start Sock hop but move right

content.description: Looking at the start of this problem will make it scream for you to give it a try, and the lack of apparent holds on the upper half make it that much more interesting.  Starting with good sidepulls for your hands and obvious feet, move up to the sloping ledge, and continue to the top using small crimps and shallow dishes.  Great movement on solid rock make this one of the best problems around.
content.location: Near the top of the Lower Ridge, you can get there by going pretty much straight downhill from the Dirt Bag and Happy Hunting Grounds.

content.description: Head up the center of the face.
content.location: Largest boulder in the field containing The Hueco Problem. Down climb is down the arete on the upper side of the corridor you came through (directly across fromThe Mantelland Hueco Problem) on your way down to the climbing area.

content.description: Start with your right hand in the foot dish for Mobius Left and your left hand on a sloper edge. Move straight up.
content.location: To the left of Mobius Left and Mobius Right.

content.description: Climb the high face immediately right of a pine tree (around the corner from Fuzzy Logic). Climb on good holds and knobs to a slightly overhanging top out with lots of pine needles on it.  Pine needles may be covering the large holds of the top out.
content.protection: Pad and a good spotter to keep you (and pad) from sliding downhill.
content.location: Located in the lowermost extent of Lower Ridge Area.  Head downhill and slightly east from the large Matters Little/Matters Not boulder (an obvious tall boulder with a knobby face).

content.description: Climb up the middle of the knobby south face of this very tall boulder.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. The base of the boulder is flat and clear of rocks and deadfall but a fall from up high is still gonna smart.
content.location: Follow the trail down the hill from HHG about 50 yards. You'll have to squeeze by the Quiet Storm boulder on your right just before you reach a clearing. From the clearing, the south face of the boulder will be right in front of you. Its the biggest boulder in the area. You'll be climbing the separate tower on the left side of the formation.

content.description:
Really just a variation of Matters Little, one can climb out of a mini dihedral on the left hand side of the wall, or the mini-wall to the left of that, above which is a very sharp(and dirty)arete that archs back to the top of the boulder.

The right side of the book, which lays back a little, is another variation.

The rock quality is great and variations abound.
content.protection: Crash pad, spot. The base of the boulder is flat and clear of rocks and deadfall but a fall from up high is still gonna smart. Down climb the north side.
content.location: Follow the trail down the hill from HHG about 50 yards. You'll have to squeeze by the Quiet Storm boulder on your right just before you reach a clearing. From the clearing, the south face of the boulder will be right in front of you. Its the biggest boulder in the area. You'll be climbing the separate tower on the left side of the formation.

content.description: Start tri-matched in the large hueco in the boulder's underside. Pretty much a one move wonder. Crux is cranking from the first to the second hueco. Good fun!
content.protection: One pad to keep your butt off the dirt. Not very high or dangerous
content.location: 20ft to the right of Burn Off, just down the hill from the happy hunting grounds cluster. I didn't see it on here and figured it deserved an entry.

content.description: Climb the right corner arete at the bottom of the corridor straight up or escape into the chimney at the top.
content.location: Largest boulder in the field containing The Hueco Problem. Down climb is down the arete on the upper side of the corridor you came through (directly across fromThe Mantelland Hueco Problem) on your way down to the climbing area.

content.description: Short slab on the north backside on The Hueco Problem boulder.
content.location: Find The Hueco Problem boulder in the Lower Ridge area and climb the slab on the north side.

content.description: Sit start at the base of very nice looking prow with 3 distinct heucos, then enjoy!
content.location: Down the hill from Sock Hop and further down the hill from Happy Hunting Grounds.

content.description: Start under the lip on good side pulls and find your way over the hump on good holds that are far apart.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter if you’re at your limit. There’s a boulder behind your back.
content.location: On the boulder that has The Burn Off and The Mantelland Hueco Problem as you’re heading down to the lower ridge area. This problem is on the far right of the boulder.

content.description: Start low trying to avoid jamming between the tree and rock, then work up the arete.
content.location: left of Modal Logic, in the lower-most part of the lower ridge area.

content.description:
Powerful climbing with engaging deadpoints. Quite full-on, and absolutely a gas to climb.

Start matched on crimp (has seen a recent application of glue), and do an awkward butt-scraping lunge to an open-handed crimp. Start blasting from there. Careful on top: some junkiness lurks.
content.protection: Good padding. Basically flat, but you can slide in to some rocks and branches if you're not careful.
content.location: If you're facing Sock Hop, turn around and walk straight downhill about 40 paces. The boulder is on the right, and Full Contact starts on the steep face with nice incut pockets.

content.description: Layback the seam and top out left on flakes or jam it straight up to some knobs and dishes. In the shade with a perfect flat and clear landing. Downclimb to the right.
content.location: Follow the trail down the hill from HHG about 50 yards. You will have to squeeze by a very large boulder(the Matters Not boulder) on your right just before you reach a clearing. From the clearing, Free Thinker is on the western edge of the clearing, slightly down hill.

content.description: Start with both hands on a continually deteriorating crimp. Make a big move to a good sized crimp and try to grovel your way over the top.
content.location: On the walk between The Hueco Project and Mobius Left take a right through a corridor behind a tall rock covered in pebbles and take a left downhill to the next boulder.

content.description: Left of Sock Hop, work patina flakes to the top.
On the same boulder as the Huecoland problem, look for a low right hand crimp and a marginal left hand. Go up using compression and some classic pine mountain slopers. Foot trickery abounds!
content.protection: Lowball. Pads are always nice though.
content.location: 20 feet to the left of the Huecoland problem, just down the hill from Sock Hop and the Happy Hunting Grounds.

content.description: Climb the right side of the slab up nice holds and smears.
content.location: Largest boulder in the field containing The Hueco Problem. Down climb is down the arete on the upper side of the corridor you came through (directly across fromThe Mantelland Hueco Problem) on your way down to the climbing area.
